entry.title: The graph topology
entry.summary: We study topological properties of the graph topology.

entry.title: Multivalued Functions in Digital Topology
entry.summary: We study several types of multivalued functions in digital topology.

entry.title: SPM Bulletin 2
entry.summary: This is the second issue of the SPM Bulletin (SPM stands for "Selection Principles in Mathematics"). The first issue is math.GN/0301011 and contains some background and details.

entry.title: A hereditarily indecomposable tree-like continuum without the fixed point property
entry.summary: A hereditarily indecomposable tree-like continuum without the fixed point property is constructed. The example answers a question of Knaster and Bellamy.

entry.title: Locally 1-to-1 maps and 2-to-1 retractions
entry.summary: This paper considers the question of which continua are 2-to-1 retracts of continua.

entry.title: On spaces Baire isomorphic to the powers of the real line
entry.summary: We characterize AE(0)-spaces that are Baire isomorphic to the powers of the real line.
entry.arxiv:comment: accepted for publication in Topology Appl

entry.title: Topological characterization of torus groups
entry.summary: Topological characterization of torus groups is given.

entry.title: Characterizing the topology of pseudo-boundaries of Euclidean spaces
entry.summary: We give a topological characterization of the n-dimensional pseudo-boundary of the (2n+1)-dimensional Euclidean space.

entry.title: Continuous selections with respect to extension dimension
entry.summary: The paper is devoted to generalization of well-known Michael's Selection theorem on the case of extension dimension.

entry.title: Les espaces duaux pour les ensembles ordonn√©s arbitraires
entry.summary: A duality between general partially ordered sets and certain topolgical spaces with two closures is established.

entry.title: Universal metric spaces according to W. Holsztynski
entry.summary: We show, following W. Holsztynski, that there exists a continuous metric d on the set of real numbers R such that any finite metric space is isometrically embeddable into (R,d).

entry.title: On spaces in countable web
entry.summary: We show that a Tychonoff discretely star-Lindelof space can have arbitrarily big extent and note that there are consistent examples of normal discretely star-Lindelof spaces with uncountable extent.

entry.title: Wallman-Frink proximities
entry.summary: This is a survey of compactification extension results and problems for a special class of proximities.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the Ninth Prague Topological Symposium, (Prague, 2001), pp. 265--270, Topology Atlas, Toronto, 2002

entry.title: Some equivalent of extremally disconnected spaces
entry.summary: We give some equivalent characterizations of exremally disconnected spaces
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Indian Journal of Pure and Applied Mathematics, 32, No.3, 343-344 (2001)

entry.title: Topologische und algebraische Filter
entry.summary: We provide the set of filters (saturated submonoids) in a commutative monoid with a topology (like the spectrum of a ring) and study the resulting spaces.

entry.title: A Compact Homogeneous S-space
entry.summary: Under the continuum hypothesis, there is a compact homogeneous strong S-space.

entry.title: Extraordinary dimension of maps
entry.summary: We establish a characterization of the extraordinary dimension of perfect maps between metrizable spaces.

entry.title: One recent development of the M_3 vs. M_1 problem
entry.summary: We survey the problem of whether M_3 spaces are M_1 spaces.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Topology Atlas Invited Contributions vol. 8, no. 1 (2003) 8 pp

entry.title: Supernearness spaces as a tool for studying unification and extensions
entry.summary: We discuss supernear spaces.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Topology Atlas Invited Contributions vol. 8, no. 3 (2003) 2 pp

entry.title: SPM Bulletin 7
entry.summary: This is the seventh issue of this bulletin, featuring a new form as well as a concise list of past open problems.

entry.title: Combinatorial Dynamics
entry.summary: This article is a short introduction to Combinatorial Dynamics for topologists.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Topology Atlas Invited Contributions 6 no. 1 (2001) 4 pp

entry.title: Partners: Functional Analysis and Topology
entry.summary: This article is a short survey of the history of functional analysis for topologists.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Topology Atlas Invited Contributions 6 no. 2 (2001) 5 pp

entry.title: PCF Theory
entry.summary: This article is a very short introduction to pcf theory for topologists.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Topology Atlas Invited Contributions 6 no. 4 (2001) 4 pp

entry.title: Cohomological dimension theory of compact metric spaces
entry.summary: This is a detailed introductory survey of the cohomological dimension theory of compact metric spaces.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Topology Atlas Invited Contributions 6, no. 3 (2001) 61 pp

entry.title: Nonmetrizable ANR's admitting a group structure are manifolds
entry.summary: It is shown that a nonmetrizable ANR-space of weight $\tau > \omega$, admitting a group structure, is (topologically) an $\text{\f R}^{\tau}$-manifold.

entry.title: Addition and subspace theorems for asymptotic large inductive dimension
entry.summary: We prove addition and subspace theorems for asymptotic large inductive dimension. We investigate a transfinite extension of this dimension and show that it is trivial.

entry.title: Axiomatization of topological space in terms of the operation of boundary
entry.summary: We present the set of axioms for topological space with the operation of boundary as primitive notion.

entry.title: Selection principles and countable dimension
entry.summary: We characterize countable dimensionality and strong countable dimensionality by means of an infinite game.

entry.title: Products and selection principles
entry.summary: The product of a Sierpinski set and a Lusin set has Menger's property. The product of a gamma set and a Lusin set has Rothberger's property.

entry.title: SPM Bulletin 23
entry.summary: A surprising number of new results in "core" SPM in the last quarter of 2007, and some other beautiful fundamental results are announced.

entry.title: Aronszajn Compacta
entry.summary: We consider a class of compacta X such that the maps from X onto metric compacta define an Aronszajn tree of closed subsets of X.

entry.title: Locally Connected HL Compacta
entry.summary: It is consistent with MA plus not CH that there is a locally connected hereditarily Lindelof compact space which is not metrizable.

entry.title: SPM Bulletin 26
entry.summary: This festive issue concludes the civilian year 2008 with details on a special issue of Topology and its Applications dedicated to SPM, and with a quite large list of research announcements.

entry.title: Having cut-points is not a Whitney reversible property
entry.summary: We show that the property of having cut-points is not a Whitney reversible property. This answers in the negative a question posed by Illanes and Nadler.

entry.title: Reflexive group topologies on Abelian groups
entry.summary: It is proved that any infinite Abelian group of infinite exponent admits a non-discrete reflexive group topology.

entry.title: Topological games and covering dimension
entry.summary: We consider a natural way of extending the Lebesgue covering dimension to various classes of infinite dimensional separable metric spaces.

entry.title: Relations that preserve compact filters
entry.summary: Many classes of maps are characterized as (possibly multi-valued) maps preserving particular types of compact filters.

entry.title: Coupled Fixed Point Theorems for Contraction Involving Rational Expressions in Partially Ordered Metric Spaces
entry.summary: We establish coupled fixed point theorems for contraction involving rational expressions in partially ordered metric spaces.

entry.title: Ciric's fixed point theorem in a cone metric space
entry.summary: In this paper, we extend a fixed point theorem due to Ciric to a cone metric space.

entry.title: Funny Problems in Intuitive Topology
entry.summary: The goal of this article is to introduce some beautiful known riddles in intuitive topology; hoping to make at least some fun for the reader.

entry.title: SPM Bulletin 30
entry.summary: This is the 30th issue of this bulletin, dedicated to mathematical selection principles and related areas. Now in a concise format.
entry.arxiv:comment: Boaz Tsaban is an editor of this bulletin

entry.title: The Collins-Roscoe mechanism and D-spaces
entry.summary: We prove that if a space X is well ordered $(\alpha A)$, or linearly semi-stratifiable, or elastic then X is a D-space.

entry.title: Z-set unknotting in uncountable products of reals
entry.summary: We prove a version of $Z$-set unknotting theorem for uncountable products of real numbers.

entry.title: Lindelof spaces which are indestructible, productive, or D
entry.summary: We discuss relationships in Lindelof spaces among the properties "indestructible", "productive", "D", and related properties.

entry.title: PFA(S)[S] and the Arhangel'skii-Tall problem
entry.summary: We discuss the Arhangel'skii-Tall problem and related questions in models obtained by forcing with a coherent Souslin tree.

entry.title: SPM Bulletin 31
entry.summary: Among the many papers announced here, a recent series of papers of Franklin Tall on selective properties (SPM) is noteworthy.
entry.arxiv:comment: Boaz Tsaban is an editor of this bulletin

entry.title: A product theorem for a general accumulation property
entry.summary: We characterize the situations in which certain accumulation properties of topological spaces are preserved under taking products.

entry.title: Probabilistic Metric Spaces as enriched categories
entry.summary: In this paper we investigate Cauchy completeness and exponentiablity for quantale enriched categories, paying particular attention to probabilistic metric spaces.

entry.title: The well-ordered (F) spaces are D-spaces
entry.summary: We studied the relationships between Collins-Roscoe mechanism and D-spaces, proved that well-ordered (F) spaces are D-spaces. This positively answered a question asked by D.Soukup and Y.Xu before.

entry.title: SPM Bulletin 33
entry.summary: 33rd issue of a bulletin dedicated to research on selective properties in mathematics.

entry.title: New characterizations of minimal cusco maps
entry.summary: We give new characterizations of minimal cusco maps in the class of all set-valued maps extending results from [BZ1] and [GM].

entry.title: Wardowski implicit contractions in metric spaces
entry.summary: Most of the implicit contractions introduced by Wardowski [Fixed Point Th. Appl., 2012, 2012:94] are Matkowski type contractions.

entry.title: Construction of topologies, filters and uniformities for a product of sets
entry.summary: Starting from filters over the set of indices, we introduce structures in a product of sets where the coordinate sets have the given structures.

entry.title: Relations between minimal usco and cusco maps
entry.summary: We study relations between minimal usco and cusco maps.
entry.arxiv:comment: arXiv admin note: substantial text overlap with arXiv:1207.1587

entry.title: SPM Bulletin 35
entry.summary: This issue contains a number of abstracts of papers directly related to selection principles, some of which presented at the conference SPMC2012, and the announcement of the solution of Malyhin's Problem.

entry.title: Exponentiable approach spaces
entry.summary: In this note we present a characterisation of exponentiable approach spaces in terms of ultrafilter convergence.

entry.title: Some bounds for the pseudocharacter of the space C(X,Y)
entry.summary: We obtained some upper bounds for the pseudocharacter of the space C(X,Y) at a point f.

entry.title: Extension of continuous functions to Baire-one functions
entry.summary: We introduce the notion of $B_1$-retract and investigate the connection between $B_1$- and $H_1$-retracts.

entry.title: On $Œ±$-embedded sets and extension of mappings
entry.summary: We introduce and study $\alpha$-embedded sets and apply them to generalize the Kuratowski Extension Theorem.

entry.title: When is a space Menger at infinity?
entry.summary: We try to characterize those Tychonoff spaces $X$ such that $\beta X \setminus X$ has the Menger property.

entry.title: On Pre-Œ≥-I-Open Sets In Ideal Topological Spaces
entry.summary: In this paper, the author introduce and study the notion of pre-{\gamma}-I-open sets in ideal topological space.

entry.title: Functionally $œÉ$-discrete mappings and a generalization of Banach's theorem
entry.summary: We present $\sigma$-strongly functionally discrete mappings which expand the class of $\sigma$-discrete mappings and generalize Banach's theorem on analytically representable functions

entry.title: Remarks on metrizability of dual groups
entry.summary: We examine sufficient conditions for the dual of a topological group to be metrizable and locally compact.

entry.title: Ordering A Square
entry.summary: We identify a condition on X that guarantees that any finite power of X is homeomorphic to a subspace of a linearly ordered space

entry.title: A normal measure on a compact connected space
entry.summary: We present a construction of a compact connected space which supports a normal probability measure.

entry.title: On perfect cones and absolute Baire-one retracts
entry.summary: We introduce perfect cones over topological spaces and study their connection with absolute $B_1$-retracts

entry.title: Generating countable groups by discrete subsets
entry.summary: Every countable topological group $G$ has a closed discrete subset $A$ such that $G=AA^{-1}.$

entry.title: SPM Bulletin 38
entry.summary: In addition to research announcements, this issue features a call for papers to a Topology and its Applications special issue, and an intriguing open problem.
entry.arxiv:comment: Boaz Tsaban is an editor of this bulletin

entry.title: On Baire-one mappings with zero-dimensional domains
entry.summary: We generalize the Lebesgue-Hausdorff Theorem on Baire classification of mappings defined on strongly zero-dimensional spaces

entry.title: Separation axioms of $Œ±^{m}$-open sets
entry.summary: In this paper, we introduce $T_{\alpha^{m}}$-Spaces, $\alpha^{m}$-closed maps and $\alpha^{m}$-open maps and studied some of their properties.

entry.title: Variations of selective separability and tightness in function spaces with set open topologies
entry.summary: We study tightness properties and selective versions of separability in bitopological function spaces endowed with set-open topologies.

entry.title: Parametric set-wise injective maps
entry.summary: We introduce the notion of set-wise injective maps and provide results about fiber embeddings. Our results improve some previous results in this area.

entry.title: Poc Sets, Median Algebras and Group Actions
entry.summary: An extended Study of Dunwoody's Construction and Sageev's Theorem

entry.title: Alan Dow
entry.summary: On the occasion of Alan Dow 60th birthday.

entry.title: SPM Bulletin 40
entry.summary: This issue surveys some of the activities in the field since the previous issue, and announces a conference fully dedicated to the topic of selection principles.

entry.title: Smooth compositions with a nonsmooth inner function
entry.summary: In this paper, we present an interesting application of Baire's category theorem.

entry.title: Fixed point theorems in $G$-metric space
entry.summary: In this article, we present a new type of fixed point for single valed mapping in a $G$-complete $G$-metric space.

entry.title: Distance Domains
entry.summary: We explore extensions of domain theoretic concepts, like completeness and continuity, replacing order relations with non-symmetric distances.

entry.title: Counting coarse subsets of a countable group
entry.summary: For every countable group $G$, there are $2^{\omega}$ distinct classes of coarsely equivalent subsets of $G$.
entry.arxiv:comment: Keywords : ballean, coarse structure, asymorphism, coarse equivalence

entry.title: All topologies come from a family of 0-1 valued quasimetrics
entry.summary: We prove the statement in the title.

entry.title: Classification of selectors for sequences of dense sets of Cp(X)
entry.summary: We give the characteristics of selectors for sequences of dense sets of Cp(X) through the selection principles of a Tychonoff space X.

entry.title: SPM Bulletin 4
entry.summary: This issue of the SPM Bulletin announces two conferences which are of interest to anyone working in SPM or general topology. In the second announced conference it is planned to have a significant part devoted to SPM. Those who are interested in participating should contact Ljubisa D. R. Kocinac at lkocinac@ptt.yu Kocinac is a very active mathematician in the field of SPM. We announce here one of his most recent works. The first issues of this bulletin, contain general information (first issue), basic definitions, research announcements, and open problems (all issues).
entry.arxiv:comment: The first three issues are also available in the Math ArXiv: math.GN/0301011, math.GN/0302062, math.GN/0303057

entry.title: Digital Shy Maps
entry.summary: We study properties of shy maps in digital topology.

entry.title: More on sg-compact spaces
entry.summary: The aim of this paper is to continue the study of sg-compact spaces, a topological notion much stronger than hereditary compactness. We investigate the relations between sg-compact and $C_2$-spaces and the interrelations to hereditarily sg-closed sets.

entry.title: Contra-semicontinuous Functions
entry.summary: The aim of this paper is to introduce and study the concept of a contra-semicontinuous function and further investigate the class of strongly $S$-closed spaces. We obtain some new decompositions of generalized continuous functions.

entry.title: G.Œõ_s-sets and G.V_s-sets
entry.summary: In this paper we define the concepts of $g.\Lambda_s$-sets and $g.V_s$-sets and we use them in order to obtain new characterizations of semi-T_1-, semi-R_0- and semi-T_{1/2}-spaces.

entry.title: An answer to a question of Pyrih
entry.summary: We answer a recent question of Pyrih by proving that a topological space $(X,\tau)$ is open-normal if and only if it is extremally disconnected.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, to appear in "Questions and Answrs in General Topology"

entry.title: Survey on preopen sets
entry.summary: The aim of this survey article is to cover most of the recent research on preopen sets. I try to present majority of the results on preopen sets that I am aware of.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in the Proceedings of the 1998 Yatsushiro Topological Conference, 22-23 August 1998

entry.title: Extremally $T_1$-spaces and Related Spaces
entry.summary: The aim of this paper is introduce and initiate the study of extremally $T_1$-spaces, i.e., the spaces where all hereditarily compact $C_2$-subspaces are closed. A $C_2$-space is a space whose nowhere dense sets are finite.

entry.title: Compactifications and universal spaces in extension theory
entry.summary: We show that for each countable simplicial complex P the following conditions are equivalent: (1) $P \in AE(X)$ iff $P \in AE(\beta X)$ for any space X; (2) There exists a P-invertible map of a metrizable compactum X with $P \in AE(X)$ onto the Hilbert cube.

entry.title: Extension dimension and refinable maps
entry.summary: Extension dimension is characterized in terms of $\omega$-maps. We apply this result to prove that extension dimension is preserved by refinable maps between metrizable spaces. It is also shown that refinable maps preserve some infinite-dimensional properties.

entry.title: Hereditary indecomposability and the Intermediate Value Theorem
entry.summary: We show that hereditarily indecomposable spaces can be characterized by a special instance of the Intermediate Value Theorem in their rings of continuous functions.

entry.title: Answering a question on relative countable paracompactness
entry.summary: We answer a question of Yasui. Morever, we show that if a Tychonoff space Y is countably 1-paracompact in every Tychonoff space X that contains Y as a closed subspace then Y is linearly Lindelof.

entry.title: Ljusternik-Schnirelmann Categories, Links and Relations
entry.summary: This paper is concerned with some well-known Ljusternik-Schnirelmann categories. We desire to find some links and relations among them. This has been done by using the concepts of precategoty, T-collection and closure of a category.

entry.title: Some mapping theorems for extensional dimension
entry.summary: We present some results related to theorems of Pasynkov and Torunczyk on the geometry of maps of finite dimensional compacta.

entry.title: Movable categories
entry.summary: The notion of movability for metrizable compacts was introduced by K.Borsuk $[1]$. In this paper we define the notion of movable category and prove that the movability of a topological space $X$ coincides with the movability of a suitable category, which is generated by the topological space $X$ (i.e., the category $W^X$, defined by S.Mardesic).

entry.title: Some questions of equivariant movability
entry.summary: In this paper the some questions of equivariant movability connected with substitution of acting group $G$ on closed subgroup $H$ and with transitions to spaces of $H$-orbits and $H$-fixed points spaces are investigated. In the special case the characterization of equivariant-movable $G$-spaces is given.

entry.title: Approximations and selections of multivalued mappings of finite-dimensional spaces
entry.summary: We prove extension-dimensional versions of finite dimensional selection and approximation theorems. As applications, we obtain several results on extension dimension.

entry.title: Topological groups with several disconnectedness
entry.summary: We investigate some properties of topological groups related to disconnectedness or Archimedeanness. We prove or disprove the preservation of those under operations as subgroups, quotients, products, etc. Characterizations of non-Archimedeanness are obtained by using embedding into universal groups. We also clarify the differences between the properties by constructing miscellaneous Polish groups.

entry.title: On dimensionally restricted maps
entry.summary: Some results of B. Pasynkov and H. Torunczyk on finite-dimensional maps are improved. A generalization of a Dranishnikov-Uspenskij theorem about extensional dimension is also obtained.

entry.title: Dense families of selections and finite-dimensional spaces
entry.summary: A characterization of $n$-dimensional spaces via continuous selections avoiding $Z_n$-sets is given, and a selection theorem for strongly countable-dimensional spaces is established. We apply these results to prove a generalized Ostrand's theorem and to obtain a new alternative proof of the Hurewicz formula.

entry.title: Continuous Selections and finite C-spaces
entry.summary: Characterizations of paracompact finite $C$-spaces via continuous selections are given. We apply these results to obtain some properties of finite $C$-spaces. Factorization theorems and a completion theorem for finite $C$- spaces are also established.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, to appear in Set-Valued Analysis

entry.title: Euler characteristic of the configuration space of a complex
entry.summary: A closed form formula (generating function) for the Euler characteristic of the configuration space of $\scriptstyle n$ particles in a simplicial complex is given.

entry.title: Some equivalences for Martin's Axiom in asymmetric topology
entry.summary: We find some statements in the language of asymmetric topology and continuous partial orders which are equivalent to the statements $\kappa < \mathfrak m$ or $\kappa < \mathfrak p$.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the Ninth Prague Topological Symposium (Prague, 2001), pp. 9--13, Topology Atlas, Toronto, 2002

entry.title: Chainable subcontinua
entry.summary: This paper is concerned with conditions under which a metric continuum (a compact connected metric space) contains a non-degenerate chainable continuum.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the Ninth Prague Topological Symposium, (Prague, 2001), pp. 71--73, Topology Atlas, Toronto, 2002}

entry.title: Transfinite sequences of continuous and Baire 1 functions on separable metric spaces
entry.summary: We investigate the existence of well-ordered sequences of Baire 1 functions on separable metric spaces.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the Ninth Prague Topological Symposium, (Prague, 2001), pp. 91--92, Topology Atlas, Toronto, 2002

entry.title: Sub-representation of posets
entry.summary: We define a property sub-representability and we give a complete characterisation of sub-representability of posets.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the Ninth Prague Topological Symposium, (Prague, 2001), pp. 135--146, Topology Atlas, Toronto, 2002

entry.title: Special metrics
entry.summary: This is a survey on special metrics. We shall present some results and open questions on special metrics mainly appeared in the last 10 years
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the Ninth Prague Topological Symposium, (Prague, 2001), pp. 155--164, Topology Atlas, Toronto, 2002

entry.title: A survey of J-spaces
entry.summary: This note is a survey of $J$-spaces.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages. This contribution is excerpted from a published article. Reprinted from Topology and its Applications, Volume 102, number 3, E. Michael, J-Spaces, pp.315--339
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the Ninth Prague Topological Symposium, (Prague, 2001), pp. 191--193, Topology Atlas, Toronto, 2002

entry.title: An Infinitary version of Sperner's lemma
entry.summary: We prove an extension of the well-known combinatorial-topological lemma of E. Sperner to the case of infinite-dimensional cubes. It is obtained as a corollary to an infinitary extension of the Lebesgue Covering Dimension Theorem.

entry.title: A natural construction for the real numbers
entry.summary: A new construction of the real number system, that is built directly upon the additive group of integers and has its roots in the definition due to Henri Poincar\'e of the rotation number of an orientation preserving homeomorphism of the circle.

entry.title: Elementarity and dimensions
entry.summary: We give an alternative proof of Fedorchuk's recent result that dim X <= Dg X for compact Hausdorff spaces X. We use the L\"{o}wenheim-Skolem theorem to reduce the problem to the metric case.

entry.title: Extensional dimension and completion of maps
entry.summary: We prove that any closed map between metrizable spaces can be extended to a closed map between completely metrizable spaces with the same extensional dimension.

entry.title: Fixed point of multivalued mapping in uniform spaces
entry.summary: In this paper we prove some new fixed point theorems for multivalued mappings on orbitally complete uniform spaces.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proc. Indian Acad. Sci. (Math. Sci.), Vol. 113, No. 2, May 2003, pp. 183-187

entry.title: On finite-sheeted covering mappings onto solenoids
entry.summary: We study limit mappings from a solenoid onto itself. It is shown that each equivalence class of finite-sheeted covering mappings from connected topological spaces onto a solenoid is determined by a limit mapping. Properties of periodic points of limit mappings are also studied.

entry.title: The Reznichenko property and the Pytkeev property in hyperspaces
entry.summary: We investigate two closure-type properties, the Reznichenko property and the Pytkeev property, in hyperspace topologies.

entry.title: Small Locally Compact Linearly Lindelof Spaces
entry.summary: There is a locally compact Hausdorff space of weight aleph_omega which is linearly Lindelof and not Lindelof. This improves an earlier result, which produced such a space of weight beth_omega.

entry.title: A representation of retracts of cubes
entry.summary: The purpose of this note is to give the full and self-contained proof of Shchepin's result on a spectral representation of retracts of cubes.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages. This note is not intended for a publication

entry.title: Compact Scattered Spaces in Forcing Extensions
entry.summary: We consider the cardinal sequences of compact scattered spaces in models where CH is false. We describe a number of models where the continuum is aleph_2 in which no such space can have aleph_2 countable levels.

entry.title: SPM Bulletin 10
entry.summary: We announce the solution of 4+21+1/2 (!) problems posed in earlier issues of the SPM Bulletin; the ``1/2'' standing for a ``consistently yes'' answer of Zdomsky to the last issue's Problem of the Month.

entry.title: Open-multicommutativity of the probability measure functor
entry.summary: For the functors acting in the category of compact Hausdorff spaces, we introduce the so-called open multi-commutativity property, which generalizes both bicommutativity and openness, and prove that this property is satisfied by the functor of probability measures.

entry.title: A sufficient condition for the insertion of a contra-continuous (Baire-one) function
entry.summary: A sufficient condition for the insertion of a contra-continuous (resp. Baire-one) function between two comparable real-valued functions is given on the topological spaces that L-sets are open (resp. G-delta-sets).

entry.title: Countable Tightness, Elementary Submodels and Homogeneity
entry.summary: We show (in ZFC) that the cardinality of a compact homogeneous space of countable tightness is no more than the size of the continuum.

entry.title: On continuity of correspondences of probability measures in the category of Tychonov spaces
entry.summary: We consider the correspondence assigning to every Radon measure on two Tychonoff coordinate spaces the set of probability measures with these marginals. It is proved that this correspondence is continuous.

entry.title: Caracteristique d'Euler des feuilletages mesures
entry.summary: We proof a foliated version of the Poincare-Hopf theorem and other results which clarify the geometric and ergodic meaning of the Euler characteristic of a measured foliation.

entry.title: A semifilter approach to selection principles II: tau*-covers
entry.summary: In this paper we settle all questions whether (it is consistent that) the properties P and Q [do not] coincide, where P and Q run over selection principles of the type U_fin(O,A).
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages; Latex2e; 1 table; Submitted to CMUC

entry.title: Gromov-Hausdorff ultrametric
entry.summary: We show that there exists a natural counterpart of the Gromov-Hausdorff metric in the class of ultrametric spaces. It is proved, in particular, that the space of all ultrametric spaces whose metric take values in a fixed countable set is homeomorphic to the space of irrationals.

entry.title: On transfinite extension of asymptotic dimension
entry.summary: We prove that a transfinite extension of asymptotic dimension asind is trivial. We introduce a transfinite extension of asymptotic dimension asdim and give an example of metric proper space which has transfinite infinite dimension.

entry.title: Monotone Versions of Countable Paracompactness
entry.summary: One possible natural monotone version of countable paracompactness, MCP, turns out to have some interesting properties. We investigate various other possible monotonizations of countable paracompactness and how they are related.

entry.title: Retracts of sigma-products of Hilbert cubes
entry.summary: We consider the sigma-product of the $\omega_{1}$-power of the Hilbert cube. This space is characterized among its retracts as the only one without $G_{\delta}$-points.

entry.title: $Z$-set unknotting in large cubes
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author. Much simpler proof of the main result was obtained which led to major changes in the presentation.

entry.title: First Countable Continua and Proper Forcing
entry.summary: Assuming the Continuum Hypothesis, there is a compact first countable connected space of weight aleph_1 with no totally disconnected perfect subsets. Each such space, however, may be destroyed by some proper forcing order which does not add reals.

entry.title: Elementary submodels and separable monotonically normal compacta
entry.summary: In this note, we use elementary submodels to prove that a separable monotonically normal compactum can be mapped on a separable metric space via a continuous function whose fibers have cardinality at most 2.

entry.title: Cardinal invariants for C-cross topologies
entry.summary: C-cross topologies are introduced. Modifcations of the Kuratowski-Ulam Theorem are considered. Cardinal invariants add, cof, cov and non with respect to meager or nowhere dense subsets are compared. Remarks on invariants cof(nwdY) are mentioned for dense subspaces Y of X.

entry.title: Open-multicommutativity of the functor of upper-continuous capacities
entry.summary: The notion of open-multicommutativity, introduced by Kozhan and Zarichnyi (2005), is investigated. The weakly normal covariant functor of upper-continuous capacities is considered. The main result of the paper is that this functor open-multicommutative.

entry.title: Simply connected homogeneous continua are not separated by arcs
entry.summary: We show that locally connected, simply connected homogeneous continua are not separated by arcs. We ask several questions about homogeneous continua which are inspired by analogous questions in geometric group theory.

entry.title: Scoring metrics on separable metric spaces
entry.summary: We define scoring metrics on separable metric spaces and show that they are always no coarser than the metrics from which they spring.

entry.title: Inverse Systems and I-Favorable Spaces
entry.summary: A compact space X is I-favorable if, and only if X can be representing as a limit of $\sigma$-complete inverse system of compact metrizable spaces with skeletal bonding maps.

entry.title: Valdivia compact groups are products
entry.summary: It is shown that every Valdivia compact group is homeomorphic to a product of metrizable compacta.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, final corrections, accepted for publication

entry.title: A Short Study of Alexandroff Spaces
entry.summary: In this paper, we discuss the basic properties of Alexandroff spaces. Several examples of Alexandroff spaces are given. We show how to construct new Alexandroff spaces from given ones. Finally, two invariants for compact Alexandroff spaces are defined and calculated for the given examples.

entry.title: A Generalization of De Vries Duality Theorem
entry.summary: Generalizing Duality Theorem of H. de Vries, we define a category which is dually equivalent to the category of all locally compact Hausdorff spaces and all perfect maps between them.

entry.title: Selection Principles and Baire spaces
entry.summary: We prove that if X is a separable metric space with the Hurewicz covering property, then the Banach-Mazur game played on X is determined. The implication is not true when "Hurewicz covering property" is replaced with "Menger covering property".

entry.title: Selective screenability and the Hurewicz property
entry.summary: We characterize the Hurewicz covering property in metrizable spaces in terms of properties of the metrics of the space. Then we show that a weak version of selective screenability, when combined with the Hurewicz property, implies selective screenability.

entry.title: Monotone versions of $Œ¥$-normality
entry.summary: We continue the study of properties related to monotone countable paracompactness, investigating various monotone versions of $\delta$-normality. We factorize monotone normality and stratifiability in terms of these weaker properties.

entry.title: On Limit Aperiodic G-Sets
entry.summary: We prove that the property to be limit aperiodic is preserved by the standard construction with groups like extension, HNN extension and free product. We also construct a non-limit aperiodic G-space.

entry.title: Combinatorial and model-theoretical principles related to regularity of ultrafilters and compactness of topological spaces. III
entry.summary: We generalize the results from "P. Lipparini, Productive $[\lambda,\mu]$-compactness and regular ultrafilters, Topology Proceedings, 21 (1996), 161--171"; in particular the present results apply to singular cardinals, too.

entry.title: A first-countable non-remainder of H
entry.summary: We give a (consistent) example of a first-countable continuum that is not a remainder of the real line.

entry.title: A property of C_p[0,1]
entry.summary: We prove that for every finite dimensional compact metric space $X$ there is an open continuous linear surjection from $C_p[0,1]$ onto $C_p(X)$. The proof makes use of embeddings introduced by Kolmogorov and Sternfeld in connection with Hilbert's 13th problem.

entry.title: A concrete co-existential map that is not confluent
entry.summary: We give a concrete example of a co-existential map between continua that is not confluent.

entry.title: (Metrically) quarter-stratifiable spaces and their applications in the theory of separately continuous functions
entry.summary: We introduce and study (metrically) quarter-stratifiable spaces and then apply them to generalize Rudin and Kuratowski-Montgomery theorems about the Baire and Borel complexity of separately continuous functions.

entry.title: On the number of inscribed squares of a simple closed curve in the plane
entry.summary: We show that for every positive integer n there is a simple closed curve in the plane (which can be taken infinitely differentiable and convex) which has exactly n inscribed squares.

entry.title: A Nonseparably Connected Metric Space as a Dense Connected Graph
entry.summary: We present a connected metric space that does not contain any nontrivial separable connected subspace. Our space is a dense connected graph of a function from the real line satisfying Cauchy's equation.

entry.title: Hyperspaces of Closed Limit Sets
entry.summary: We study Michael's lower semifinite topology and Fell's topology on the collection of all closed limit subsets of a topological space. Special attention is given to the subfamily of all maximal limit sets.

entry.title: Mazurkiewicz manifolds and homogeneity
entry.summary: It is proved that no region of a homogeneous locally compact, locally connected metric space can be cut by an $F_\sigma$-subset of a "smaller" dimension. The result applies to different finite or infinite topological dimensions of metrizable spaces.

entry.title: The number of weakly compact convex subsets of the Hilbert space
entry.summary: We prove that for k an uncountable cardinal, there exist 2^k many non homeomorphic weakly compact convex subsets of weight k in the Hilbert space of density k.

entry.title: Fiber orders and compact spaces of uncountable weight
entry.summary: We study an order relation on the fibers of a continuous map and its application to the study of the structure of compact spaces of uncountable weight.

entry.title: A De Vries-type Duality Theorem for Locally Compact Spaces -- I
entry.summary: A duality theorem for the category of locally compact Hausdorff spaces and continuous maps which generalizes the well-known Duality Theorem of de Vries is proved.

entry.title: A note on the commutativity of inverse limit and orbit map
entry.summary: We show that the inverse limit and the orbit map commute for actions of compact groups on compact Hausdorff spaces.

entry.title: $\varkappa$-metrizable compacta and superextensions
entry.summary: A characterization of $\varkappa$-metrizable compacta in terms of extension of functions and usco retractions into superextensions is established.

entry.title: Different versions of mapping class groups of surfaces
entry.summary: We give a short, mostly elementary and self-contained proof of the classical result that the groups of diffeomorphisms, homeomorphisms, and homotopy equivalences of a surface have the same group of connected components.

entry.title: Measurable cardinals and the cardinality of Lindel√∂f spaces
entry.summary: If it is consistent that there is a measurable cardinal, then it is consistent that all points g-delta Rothberger spaces have "small" cardinality.

entry.title: Metrisability of Manifolds
entry.summary: Manifolds have uses throughout and beyond Mathematics and it is not surprising that topologists have expended a huge effort in trying to understand them. In this article we are particularly interested in the question: `when is a manifold metrisable?' We describe many conditions equivalent to metrisability.

entry.title: On the realization of graph as invariant of pseudoharmonic functions
entry.summary: Necessary and sufficient conditions for a finite connected graph with a strict partial order on vertices to be a combinatorial invariant of pseudoharmonic function are obtained.

entry.title: The Banach-Alaoglu theorem is equivalent to the Tychonoff theorem for compact Hausdorff spaces
entry.summary: In this brief note we provide a simple approach to give a new proof of the well known fact that the Banach-Alaoglu theorem and the Tychonoff product theorem for compact Hausdorff spaces are equivalent.

entry.title: Sequential order under CH
entry.summary: Revisiting and completing a work due to A. I. Ba\v{s}kirov, we construct compact sequential spaces of any sequential order up to and including $\omega_1$ as quotient spaces of $\beta\omega$ under CH.

entry.title: Compact spaces that do not map onto finite products
entry.summary: We provide examples of nonseparable compact spaces with the property that any continuous image which is homeomorphic to a finite product of spaces has a maximal prescribed number of nonseparable factors.

entry.title: Products of compact filters and applications to classical product theorems
entry.summary: Two results on product of compact filters are shown to be the common principle behind a surprisingly large number of theorems.

entry.title: Quantum invariants of 3-manifolds associated to restricted quantum groups
entry.summary: We show that the Witten-Reshetikhin-Turaev SU(2) invariant and the Hennings invariant associated to the restricted quantum $sl_2$ are essentially the same for rational homology 3-spheres.

entry.title: Remarks on the preservation of topological covering properties under Cohen forcing
entry.summary: Iwasa investigated the preservation of various covering properties of opological spaces under Cohen forcing. By improving the argument in Iwasa's paper, we prove that the Rothberger property, the Menger property and selective screenability are also preserved under Cohen forcing and forcing with the measure algebra.

entry.title: Skeletal maps and I-favorable spaces
entry.summary: It is showed that the class of all compact Hausdorff and $I$-favorable spaces is adequate for the class of skeletal maps.
entry.arxiv:comment: The manuscript is submitted for a regular publication.

entry.title: Every weakly initially m-compact topological space is mpcap
entry.summary: The statement in the title solves a problem raised by T. Retta. We also present a variation of the result in terms of $[ \mu ,\kappa ]$-compactness.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Czechoslovak Mathematical Journal, vol. 61, no. 3 (2011), pp. 781-784

entry.title: Coupled fixed point theorems in partially ordered Œµ-chainable metric spaces
entry.summary: In this paper, we introduce the notion of partially ordered {\epsilon}-chainable metric spaces and we derive new coupled fixed point theorems for uniformly locally contractive mappings on such spaces.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in The Journal of Mathematics and Computer Science (TJMCS)

entry.title: Guessing clubs for aD, non D-spaces
entry.summary: We prove that there exists a 0-dimensional, scattered $T_2$ space $X$ such that $X$ is aD but not linearly D, answering a question of Arhangel'skii. The constructions are based on Shelah's club guessing principles.

entry.title: Weakly Semi-Preopen and Semi-Preclosed Functions in L-fuzzy Topological Spaces
entry.summary: A new class of functions called L-fuzzy weakly Semi-Preopen (Semi-Preclosed) functions in L-fuzzy topological spaces are introduced in this paper. Some characterizations of this class and its properties and the relationship with other classes of functions between L-fuzzy topological spaces are also obtained.

entry.title: Jordan and Schoenflies in non-metrical analysis situs
entry.summary: We show that both, the Jordan curve theorem and the Schoenflies theorem extend to non-metric manifolds (at least in the two-dimensional context), and conclude by some dynamical applications \`a la Poincar\'e-Bendixson.

entry.title: Topologies on groups determined by sequences: Answers to several questions of I.Protasov and E.Zelenyuk
entry.summary: We answer several questions of I.Protasov and E.Zelenyuk concerning topologies on groups determined by T-sequences. A special attention is paid to studying the operation of supremum of two group topologies.

entry.title: Short proof of a theorem of Juhasz
entry.summary: We give a simple proof of the increasing strengthening of Arhangel'skii's Theorem. Our proof naturally leads to a refinement of this result of Juh\'asz.

entry.title: Coincidence and Common Fixed Point Results for Contraction Type Maps in Partially Ordered Metric Spaces
entry.summary: We present coincidence and common fixed point results of selfmappings satisfying a contraction type in partially ordered metric spaces. As an application, we give an existence theorem for a common solution of integral equations.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in International Journal of Math. and Applications

entry.title: On $Œ≥$-Semi-Continuous Functions
entry.summary: In this paper, we continue studying the properties of $\gamma$-semi-continuous and $\gamma$-semi-open functions introduced in [5].
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper have been published in Punjab University Journal of Mathematics
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Punjab University Journal of Mathematics, Vol. 42 (2010) pp. 57-65

entry.title: Some fixed point results in ordered partial metric spaces
entry.summary: In this paper, we establish some fixed point theorems in ordered partial metric spaces. An example is given to illustrate our obtained results.
entry.arxiv:comment: Accepted in The Journal of Nonlinear Sciences and Applications

entry.title: Selections for Paraconvex-valued Mappings on Non-paracompact Domains
entry.summary: We prove that Michael's paraconvex-valued selection theorem for paracompact spaces remains true for C'(E)-valued mappings defined on collectionwise normal spaces. Some possible generalisations are also given.

entry.title: Some Coupled Fixed Point Results on Partial Metric Spaces
entry.summary: In this paper we give some coupled fixed point results for mappings satisfying different contractive conditions on complete partial metric spaces.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in International Journal of Mathematics and Mathematical Sciences

entry.title: Duality Between Uniform Spaces and Boolean Algebras
entry.summary: In this note we shall generalize the Stone duality between compact totally disconnected spaces and Boolean algebras to a duality between all complete non-Archimedean uniform spaces and Boolean algebras.

entry.title: Star-covering properties: generalized $Œ®$-spaces, countability conditions, reflection
entry.summary: We investigate star-covering properties of $\Psi$-like spaces. We show star-Lindel\"ofness is reflected by open perfect mappings. In addition, we offer a new equivalence of CH.

entry.title: Productively Lindelof spaces may all be D
entry.summary: We give easy proofs that a) the Continuum Hypothesis implies that if the product of X with every Lindelof space is Lindelof, then X is a D-space, and b) Borel's Conjecture implies every Rothberger space is Hurewicz.

entry.title: On the hereditary paracompactness of locally compact, hereditarily normal spaces
entry.summary: We establish that if it is consistent that there is a supercompact cardinal, then it is consistent that every locally compact, hereditarily normal space which does not include a perfect pre-image of omega_1 is hereditarily paracompact.

entry.title: PFA(S)[S] and Locally Compact Normal Spaces
entry.summary: We examine locally compact normal spaces in models of form PFA(S)[S], in particular characterizing paracompact, countably tight ones as those which include no perfect pre-image of omega_1 and in which all separable closed subspaces are Lindelof.

entry.title: On a theorem of Arvanitakis
entry.summary: Arvanitakis established recently a theorem which is a common generalization of Michael's convex selection theorem and Dugundji's extension theorem. In this note we provide a short proof of a more general version of Arvanitakis' result.

entry.title: I^K-convergence
entry.summary: In this paper we introduce I^K-convergence which is a common generalization of the I^K-convergence of sequences, double sequences and nets. We show that many results that were shown before for these special cases are true for the I^K-convergence, too

entry.title: SPM Bulletin 32
entry.summary: In addition to announcements of several new papers, this issue contains a brief personal memorandum for Misha Matveev. The issue also announces the coming SPM meeting (June 2012).
entry.arxiv:comment: Boaz Tsaban is an editor of this bulletin

entry.title: A Spectral Sequence Connecting Continuous With Locally Continuous Group Cohomology
entry.summary: We present a spectral sequence connecting the continuous and 'locally continuous' group cohomologies for topological groups. As an application it is shown that for contractible topological groups these cohomology concepts coincide. Similar results for k-groups and smooth cochains on Lie groups are also obtained.

entry.title: Volumes in Hyperbolic Space
entry.summary: This paper focuses on the investigation of volumes of large Coxeter hyperbolic polyhedron. First, the paper investigates the smallest possible volume for a large Coxeter hyperbolic polyhedron and then looks at the volume of pyramids with one vertex at infinity.

entry.title: Selected results on selection principles
entry.summary: We review some selected recent results concerning selection principles in topology and their relations with several topological constructions.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the Third Seminar on Geometry and Topology, July 15--17, 2004, Tabriz, Iran, pp. 71-104

entry.title: On Soft Connectedness
entry.summary: The soft topological spaces and some their related concepts have stud- ied in [7]. In this paper, we introduce and study the notions of soft connected topological spaces after a review of preliminary definitions.

entry.title: Function contractive maps in partial metric spaces
entry.summary: Some fixed point results are given for a class of functional contractions over partial metric spaces. These extend some contributions in the area due to Ilic et al [Math. Comput. Modelling, 55 (2012), 801-809].

entry.title: On uniform metrizability of the functor of idempotent probability measures
entry.summary: In the present paper we show that the functor of idempotent probability measures satisfies all of conditions with an additional claim of uniform metrizability of functors.

entry.title: On perfect metrizability of the functor of idempotent probability measures
entry.summary: In this paper we establish that the functor of idempotent probability measures acting in the category of compacta and their continuous mappings is perfect metrizable.

entry.title: A fixed point theorem for contractive mappings that characterizes metric completeness
entry.summary: Inspired by the work of Suzuki in [Proc. Amer. Math. Soc. 136 (2008), 1861--1869] we prove a fixed point theorem for contractive mappings that generalizes a theorem of Geraghty in [Proc. Amer. Math. Soc., 40 (1973), 604--608] and characterizes metric completeness.

entry.title: An internal topological characterization of the subspaces of Eberlein compacts and related compacts -- I
entry.summary: We obtain an internal topological characterization of the subspaces of Eberlein compacts (respectively, Corson compacts, strong Eberlein compacts, uniform Eberlein compacts, $n$-uniform Eberlein compacts).

entry.title: Functional contractions in local Branciari metric spaces
entry.summary: A fixed point result is given for a class of functional contractions over local Branciari metric spaces. It extends some contributions in the area due to Fora et al [Mat. Vesnik, 61 (2009), 203-208].

entry.title: SPM Bulletin 34
entry.summary: This is the 34th issue of this bulletin, dedicated to selection principles in mathematics. Announcements include, among other things, a call for papers for the Topology and its Applications special issue on selection principles, and the solution of the minimal tower problem in a surprising way.
entry.arxiv:comment: Boaz Tsaban is an editor of this bulletin

entry.title: Extending Group Actions
entry.summary: We show sufficient criteria for a group of homeomorphisms acting on a metric space X to extend to one acting on a given compactification of X. We give examples for when this can fail when one of the criteria is not met.

entry.title: Productivity of $[Œº, Œª]$-compactness
entry.summary: We show that if $\mu \leq \cf \lambda $ and $\lambda$ is a strong limit singular cardinal, then $[\mu, \lambda ]$-compactness is productive if and only if either $\mu= \omega $, or $\mu$ is $\lambda$-strongly compact.

entry.title: Hereditarily Normal Wijsman Hyperspaces Are Metrizable
entry.summary: In this paper, we study normality and metrizability of Wijsman hyperspaces. We show that every hereditarily normal Wijsman hyperspace is metrizable. This provides a partially answer to a problem of Di Maio and Meccariello in 1998.

entry.title: Some observations on compact indestructible spaces
entry.summary: Inspired by a recent work of Dias and Tall, we show that a compact indestructible space is sequentially compact. We also prove that a Lindelof Hausdorff indestructible space has the finite derived set property and a compact Hausdorff indestructible space is pseudoradial.

entry.title: A Fixed Point Theorem for Kannan-type Maps in Metric Spaces
entry.summary: We prove a generalization of Kannan's fixed point theorem, based on a recent result of Vittorino Pata.

entry.title: There is no monad based on Hartman-Mycielski functor
entry.summary: We show that there is no monad based on the normal functor $H$ introduced earlier by Radul which is a certain functorial compactification of the Hartman-Mycielski construction $HM$.

entry.title: Nonstandard Topology without Logic, Ultrafilters as infinitesimal points in topological space
entry.summary: Nonstandard analysis is very complex, so finding a simple description of infinitesimal points will be useful. In this paper, ultrafilters as infinitesimal points in a topological space will be proposed, and some topological concepts is restated by this tools.

entry.title: A note on free paratopological groups
entry.summary: In this paper, we mainly discuss some generalized metric properties and the character of the free paratopological groups, and extend several results valid for free topological groups to free paratopological groups.

entry.title: Common fixed points for Banach-Caristi contractive pairs
entry.summary: Further extensions are given for the common fixed point statement in Dien [J. Math. Anal. Appl., 187 (1994), 76-90], involving Banach-Caristi contractive pairs.

entry.title: Compact fuzzy soft spaces
entry.summary: In this article, by using basic properties of fuzzy soft topology we defined fuzzy soft compactness. We also introduced some basic definitions and theorems of the concept.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Annals of Fuzzy Mathematics and Informatics, 7, No. 1, January 2014, pp. 45-51

entry.title: Bornological modifications of hyperspace topologies
entry.summary: The bornological convergence structures that have been studied recently as generalizations of Attouch-Wets convergence define pretopologies on hyperspaces. In this paper we characterize the topological reflections of these pretopologies and translate the constructions necessary to define bornological convergence to a broader spectrum of hyperspace topologies.

entry.title: Dimension of Alexandrov Topologies
entry.summary: We prove that the Krull dimension of an Alexandrov space of finite height can be characterised with the specialisation preorder of its associated $T_0$-space.

entry.title: On linear topological spaces (linearly) homeomorphic to $R^\infty$
entry.summary: We prove that every infinite-dimensional (locally convex) linear topological space that can be expressed as a direct limit of finite-dimensional metrizable compacta is (linearly) homeomorphic to the space $R^\infty=\dlim R^n$.

entry.title: Discontinuity points of a function with a closed and connected graph
entry.summary: The main result of this paper states that for a function $f:\R^2\to Y$ with a closed, connected and locally connected graph, where $Y$ is a locally compact, second-countable metrisable space, the graph over discontinuity points remains locally connected.

entry.title: Minimal R_1, minimal regular and minimal presober topologies
entry.summary: By means of filters, minimal R_1 and minimal regular topologies are characterized on suitable intervals consisting of non-trivial R_0 topologies.

entry.title: Contractive maps in Mustafa-Sims metric spaces
entry.summary: The fixed point result in Mustafa-Sims metrical structures obtained by Karapinar and Agarwal [Fixed Point Th. Appl., 2013, 2013:154] is deductible from a corresponding one stated in terms of anticipative contractions over the associated (standard) metric space.

entry.title: Questions on the Borel Complexity of Characterized Subgroups
entry.summary: We propose various problems about Borel complexity of characterized subgroups of compact abelian groups, inspired by our forthcoming paper \cite{DI3}.

entry.title: Cauchy filters from Pelant's games
entry.summary: The language of finite games is used to rephrase Pelant's proof of his result: The separable modification of the complete metric space $C([0,\omega_1])$ is not complete.

entry.title: A memo on chains and their topologies
entry.summary: We summarize some facts on chains (totally ordered sets), from an order-theoretic and from a topological point of view. We highlight the fact that many classical theorems that are true for partially ordered sets under some completeness assumption remain true for chains without any kind of completeness.

entry.title: Boundedness of Functions on Product Spaces by Sums of Functions on the Factors
entry.summary: We investigate sufficient conditions for real-valued functions on product spaces to be bounded from above by sums or products of functions which depend only on points in the respective factors.

entry.title: Topological entropy for automorphisms of totally disconnected locally compact groups
entry.summary: We give a "limit-free formula" simplifying the computation of the topological entropy for topological automorphisms of totally disconnected locally compact groups. This result allows us to extend several basic properties of the topological entropy known to hold for compact groups.

entry.title: On graph-like continua of finite length
entry.summary: We extend the notion of effective resistance to metric spaces that are similar to graphs but can also be similar to fractals. Combined with other basic facts proved in the paper, this lays the ground for a construction of Brownian Motion on such spaces completed in [10].

entry.title: Characterization of compact monotonically ($œâ$)-monolithic spaces using system of retractions
entry.summary: We prove that a compact space is monotonically Sokolov if and only if it is monotonically $\omega$-monolithic. This gives answers to several questions of R. Rojas-Hernandez and V. V. Tkachuk.

entry.title: Classical mathematical structures within topological graph theory
entry.summary: Finite simple graphs are a playground for classical areas of mathematics. We illustrate this by looking at some theorems. These are slightly enhanced preparation notes for a talk given at the joint AMS meeting of January 16, 2014 in Baltimore.

entry.title: An embedding in the Fell topology
entry.summary: It is shown that if a $T_2$ topological space contains an uncountable closed discrete set, then $\omega_1 \times (\omega_1 + 1)$ embeds as a closed subspace of $(CL(X),\tau_F)$, the hyperspace of nonempty closed subsets of $X$ equipped with the Fell topology.

entry.title: Selective Games on Binary Relations
entry.summary: We present a unified approach, based on dominating families in binary relations, for the study of topological properties defined in terms of selection principles and the games associated to them.

entry.title: Some observations on filters with properties defined by open covers
entry.summary: We study the relation between the Hurewicz and Menger properties of filters considered topologically as subspaces of P(\omega) with the Cantor set topology.

entry.title: Nonexistence of Countable Extremally Disconnected Groups with Many Open Subgroups
entry.summary: It is proved that the existence of a countable extremally disconnected Boolean topological group containing a family of open subgroups whose intersection has empty interior implies the existence of a rapid ultrafilter.

entry.title: Separation of analytic sets by rectangles of low complexity
entry.summary: We provide Hurewicz tests for the separation of disjoint analytic sets by rectangles of the form $\Gamma\times\Gamma'$ for $\Gamma,\Gamma'\in {\mathbf\Sigma^0_1 , \mathbf\Pi^0_1 , \mathbf\Pi^0_2 }$.

entry.title: Products of finite groups and nonmeasurable subgroups
entry.summary: It is proven that if $G$ is a finite group, then $G^\omega$ has $2^{\mathfrak c}$ dense nonmeasurable subgroups. Also, other examples of compact groups with dense nonmeasurable subgroups are presented.

entry.title: A characterization of free locally convex spaces over metrizable spaces which have countable tightness
entry.summary: We prove that the free locally convex space $L(X)$ over a metrizable space $X$ has countable tightness if and only if $X$ is separable.

entry.title: CH and the Moore-Mrowka Problem
entry.summary: We show that the Continuum Hypothesis is consistent with all regular spaces of hereditarily countable $\pi$-character being C-closed. This gives us a model of ZFC in which the Continuum Hypothesis holds and compact Hausdorff spaces of countable tightness are sequential.

entry.title: A bounded coarse structure for families of pseudometrics
entry.summary: We define the bounded coarse structure attached to a family of pseudometrics and give some counterexamples to conjectures that arise naturally.

entry.title: D-measurability and t-Wright convex functions
entry.summary: In the paper we will prove that each t-Wright convex function, which is bounded above on a D-measurable non-Haar meager set is continuous. Our paper refers to papers \cite{Olbrys}, \cite{Jablonska} and a problem posed by K.Baron and R.Ger.

entry.title: Some Properties of Mappings on Generalized Topological Spaces
entry.summary: This paper considers generalizations of open mappings, closed mappings, pseudo-open mappings, and quotient mappings from topological spaces to generalized topological spaces. Characterizations of these classes of mappings are obtained and some relationships among these classes are established.

entry.title: Nonseparable growth of the integers supporting a measure
entry.summary: Assuming $\mathfrak b = \mathfrak c$ (or some weaker statement), we construct a compactification $\gamma\omega$ of $\omega$ such that its remainder $\gamma\omega\setminus\omega$ is nonseparable and carries a strictly positive measure.

entry.title: $Œª$-perfect maps
entry.summary: The $\lambda$-perfect maps, a generalization of perfect maps (continuous closed maps with compact fibers) are presented. Using $P_\lambda$-spaces and the concept of $\lambda$-compactness some results regarding $\lambda$-perfect maps will be investigated.

entry.title: A not metrizable space filled with any n mutually disjoint self-similar spaces
entry.summary: A Lambda (Card Lambda > aleph)-product space of {0,1} has a partition {X1,...,Xn} for any n a decomposition space of each Xi of which is self-similar.(February 16, 2015)

entry.title: A compactness result in approach theory with an application to the continuity approach structure
entry.summary: We establish a compactness result in approach theory which we apply to obtain a generalization of Prokhorov's Theorem for the continuity approach structure.

entry.title: A note on local properties in products
entry.summary: We give conditions under which a product of topological spaces satisfies some local property. The conditions are necessary and sufficient when the corresponding global property is preserved under finite products. Further examples include local sequential compactness, local Lindel\"ofness, the local Menger property.

entry.title: A theorem of Piccard's type and its applications to polynomial functions and convex functions of higher orders
entry.summary: In the paper a theorem of Piccard's type is proved and, consequently, the continuity of $\mathcal{D}$-measurable polynomial functions of $n$-th order as well as $\mathcal{D}$-measurable $n$-convex functions is shown. The paper refers to the papers \cite{Gajda} and \cite{EJ}.

entry.title: Existence of a space filled with an arbitrary finite number of mutually disjoint self-similar spaces
entry.summary: We discuss a sufficient condition for a space to be filled with an arbitrary finite number of self-similar spaces using a topological concept.

entry.title: Some observations on the Baireness of C_k(X) for a locally compact space X
entry.summary: We prove some consistency results concerning the Moving Off Property for locally compact spaces and thus the question of whether their function spaces are Baire.

entry.title: Compact spaces with a $\mathbb{P}$-diagonal
entry.summary: We prove that compact Hausdorff spaces with a $\mathbb{P}$-diagonal are metrizable.

entry.title: Topological stability of continuous functions with respect to averagings
entry.summary: We present sufficient conditions for topological stability of continuous functions $f:\mathbb{R}\to\mathbb{R}$ having finitely many local extrema with respect to averagings by discrete measures with finite supports.

entry.title: On U-equivalence spaces
entry.summary: In this paper induced U-equivalence spaces are introduced and discussed. Also the notion of U-equivalently open subsets of a U-equivalence space and U-equivalently open functions are studied. Finally, equivalently uniformisable topological spaces are considered.

entry.title: On Baire classification of mappings with values in connected spaces
entry.summary: We generalize the Lebesgue-Hausdorff Theorem on the characterization of Baire-one functions for $\sigma$-strongly functionally discrete mappings defined on arbitrary topological spaces

entry.title: On composition of Baire functions
entry.summary: We study the maps between topological spaces whose composition with Baire class $\alpha$ maps also belongs to the $\alpha$'th Baire class and give characterizations of such maps

entry.title: Remarks on asymptotic power dimension
entry.summary: Using a result of Dranishnikov and Smith we prove that, under some conditions, the asymptotic power dimension of a proper metric space coincides with the dimension of its subpower corona.

entry.title: Compact spaces of the first Baire class that have open finite degree
entry.summary: We introduce the open degree of a compact space, and we show that for every natural number n, the separable Rosenthal compact spaces of degree n have a finite basis.

entry.title: Ideal equal Baire classes
entry.summary: For any Borel ideal we characterize ideal equal Baire system generated by the families of continuous and quasi-continuous functions, i.e., the families of ideal equal limits of sequences of continuous and quasi-continuous functions.

entry.title: Œ±$ $^m $ Continuous Maps in Topological Spaces
entry.summary: The main aim of the present paper is to introduce new classes of functions called $ \alpha $ $^m $ continuous maps and $ \alpha $ $^m $ irresolute maps. We obtain some characterizations of these classes and properties are studied.

entry.title: Metrizable DH-spaces with a dense complete subset
Namioka spaces and strongly Baire spaces
entry.summary: A notion of strongly Baire space is introduced. Its definition is a transfinite development of some equivalent reformulation of the Baire space definition. It is shown that every strongly Baire space is a Namioka space and every $\beta-\sigma$-unfavorable space is a strongly Baire space.

entry.title: Separate continuity topology and a generalization of Sierpinski's theorem
entry.summary: The separately continuity topology is considered and some its properties are investigated. With help of these properties a generalization of Sierpinski theorem on determination of real separately continuous function by its values on an arbitrary dense set is obtained.

entry.title: On separability of the functional space with the open-point and bi-point-open topologies
entry.summary: In this paper we study the property of separability of functional space with the open-point and bi-point-open topologies.

entry.title: An example of a non-Borel locally-connected finite-dimensional topological group
entry.summary: Answering a question posed by S.Maillot in MathOverFlow, for every $n\in\mathbb N$ we construct a locally connected subgroup $G\subset\mathbb R^{n+1}$ of dimension $dim(G)=n$, which is not locally compact.

entry.title: On separability of the functional space with the open-point and bi-point-open topologies, II
entry.summary: In this paper we continue to study the property of separability of functional space C(X) with the open-point and bi-point-open topologies.

entry.title: On sequential separability of functional spaces
entry.summary: In this paper, we give necessary and sufficient conditions for the space B_1(X) of first Baire class functions on a Tychonoff space X, with pointwise topology, to be (strongly) sequentially separable.

entry.title: On extension functions for image space with different separation axioms
entry.summary: In this paper we study a sufficient conditions for continuous and almost continuous extensions of f to space X for an image space Y with different separation axioms.

entry.title: Every filter is homeomorphic to its square
entry.summary: We show that every filter $\mathcal{F}$ on $\omega$, viewed as a subspace of $2^\omega$, is homeomorphic to $\mathcal{F}^2$. This generalizes a theorem of van Engelen, who proved that this holds for Borel filters.

entry.title: The asymptotic dimension of quotients by finite groups
entry.summary: Let $X$ be a proper metric space and let $F$ be a finite group acting on $X$ by isometries. We show that the asymptotic dimension of $F\backslash X$ is the same as the asymptotic dimension of $X$.

entry.title: Sober metric approach spaces
entry.summary: It is proved that a metric space is sober, as an approach space, if and only if it is Smyth complete.

entry.title: PFA(S)[S] for the masses
entry.summary: We present S. Todorcevic's method of forcing with a coherent Souslin tree over restricted iteration axioms as a black box usable by those who wish to avoid its complexities but still access its power.

entry.title: The Topos Of A Connectivity Space
entry.summary: In this short note, a topos - called the topos of the connectivity space - is associated with every such space.

entry.title: Relating games of Menger, countable fan tightness, and selective separability
entry.summary: By adapting techniques of Arhangel'skii, Barman, and Dow, we may equate the existence of perfect-information, Markov, and tactical strategies between two interesting selection games. These results shed some light on Gruenhage's question asking whether all strategically selectively separable spaces are Markov selectively separable.

entry.title: Large widely-connected spaces
entry.summary: We show that there are widely-connected spaces of arbitrarily large cardinality, answering a question by David Bellamy.

entry.title: Convergence in topological groups and the Cohen reals
entry.summary: We show that it is consistent to have an uncountable sequential group of intermediate sequential order while no countable such groups exist. This is proved by adding $\omega_2$ Cohen reals to a model of $\diamondsuit$.

entry.title: Sobriety of quantale-valued cotopological spaces
entry.summary: For each commutative and integral quantale, making use of the fuzzy order between closed sets, a theory of sobriety for quantale-valued cotopological spaces is established based on irreducible closed sets.

entry.title: On regular but not completely regular spaces
entry.summary: We present how to obtain non-comparable regular but not completely regular spaces. We analyze a generalization of Mysior's example, extracting its underlying purely set-theoretic framework. This enables us to build simple counterexamples, using the Niemytzki plane, the Songefrey plane or Lusin gaps.

entry.title: Variations on countable tightness
entry.summary: We consider 9 natural tightness conditions for topological spaces that are all variations on countable tightness and investigate the interrelationships between them. Several natural open problems are raised.

entry.title: On selective sequentially separability of space of Borel functions
entry.summary: In this paper we consider some properties of a space B(X) of Borel functions on a set of reals X, with pointwise topology, that are stronger than separability.

entry.title: New fixed point results on $G$-metric spaces
entry.summary: In this note, we discuss some fixed point theorems for contractive self mappings defined on a $G$-metric spaces. More precisely, we give fised point theorems for mappings with a contractive iterate at a point.

entry.title: Absolute $F_{œÉŒ¥}$ spaces
entry.summary: We prove that hereditarily Lindel\"of space which is $F_{\sigma\delta}$ in some compactification is absolutely $F_{\sigma\delta}$. In particular, this implies that any separable Banach space is absolutely $F_{\sigma\delta}$ when equipped with the weak topology.

entry.title: New examples of non-commutative Valdivia compact spaces
entry.summary: The aim of this note is to characterize trees, endowed with coarse wedge topology, that have a retractional skeleton. We use this characterization to provide new examples of non-commutative Valdivia compact spaces that are not Valdivia.

entry.title: Internal characterizations of productively Lindel√∂f spaces
entry.summary: We present an internal characterization for the productively Lindel\"of property, thus answering a long-standing problem attributed to Tamano. We also present some results about the relation Alster spaces vs. productively Lindel\"of spaces.

entry.title: A remark on a theorem of Iliadis concerning isometrically containing mappings
entry.summary: In this paper we give an alternative proof and a refinement of a recent result of S.D.Iliadis concerning isometrically containing mappings. We address also a recent result by A.I.Oblakova.

entry.title: On the openness of the idempotent barycenter map
entry.summary: We show that the openness of the idempotent barycenter map is equivalent to the openness of the map of Max-Plus convex combination. As corollary we obtain that the idempotent barycenter map is open for the spaces of idempotent measures.

entry.title: Upper and lower Lebesgue classification of multivalued mappings of two variables
entry.summary: We introduce a functional Lebesgue classification of multivalued mappings and obtain results on upper and lower Lebesgue classifications of multivalued mappings $F:X\times Y\to Z$ for wide classes of spaces $X$, $Y$ and $Z$.

entry.title: Knot theory of Morse-Bott critical loci
entry.summary: We give an alternative proof of that a critical knot of a Morse-Bott function $f: S^3 \rightarrow \mathbb{R}$ is a graph knot where the critical set of $f$ is a link in $S^3$. Our proof inducts on the number of index-1 critical knots of $f$.

entry.title: Each graph inverse semigroup embeds into a $Œª$-polycyclic monoid
entry.summary: In this paper we prove that a graph inverse semigroup $G(E)$ over a directed graph $E$ embeds into the $\lambda$-polycyclic monoid $\mathcal{P}_{\lambda}$ where $\lambda=|G(E)|$. Moreover, each countable graph inverse semigroup embeds into the polycyclic monoid $\mathcal{P}_{2}$.

entry.title: Some topological and combinatorial properties preserved by inverse limits
entry.summary: We show that the following properties are preserved under inverse limits: countable fan-tightness, q+, discrete generation and selective separability. We also present several examples based on inverse limits of countable spaces.

entry.title: The free locally convex space $L(\mathbf{s})$ over a convergent sequence $\mathbf{s}$ is not a Mackey space
entry.summary: We show that the free locally convex space $L(\mathbf{s})$ over a convergent sequence $\mathbf{s}$ is not a Mackey space. Consequently $L(\mathbf{s})$ is not a Mackey group that answers negatively a question posed in [4].

entry.title: Additivity properties of topological diagonalizations
entry.summary: We answer a question of Just, Miller, Scheepers and Szeptycki whether certain diagonalization properties for sequences of open covers are provably closed under taking finite or countable unions. This is a very concise paper. For a self-contained, complete, and extended treatment of the topic see math.GN/0604451
entry.arxiv:comment: All pointers to the current e-print for a complete version should be redirected to math.GN/0604451

entry.title: Ordered Spaces, Metric Preimages, and Function Algebras
entry.summary: We consider the Complex Stone-Weierstrass Property (CSWP), which is the complex version of the Stone-Weierstrass Theorem. If X is a compact subspace of a product of three linearly ordered spaces, then X has the CSWP if and only if X has no subspace homeomorphic to the Cantor set. In addition, every finite power of the double arrow space has the CSWP. These results are proved using some results about those compact Hausdorff spaces which have scattered-to-one maps onto compact metric spaces.
entry.arxiv:comment: 30 pages. This version uses the author's paper Dissipated Compacta (math.GN/0703429) to simplify and strengthen the results in the previous version

entry.title: Another homogeneous, non-bihomogeneous Peano continuum
entry.summary: K. Kuperberg found a locally connected, finite-dimensional continuum which is homogeneous but not bihomogeneous. We give a similar but simpler example. Like previous constructions, the example is locally a Cartesian product of Menger spaces. The new idea is to choose a fundamental group in which not every element is conjugate to its inverse.

entry.title: Bihomogeneity and Menger manifolds
entry.summary: For every triple of integers a, b, and c, such that a>O, b>0, and c>1, there is a homogeneous, non-bihomogeneous continuum whose every point has a neighborhood homeomorphic the Cartesian product of three Menger compacta m^a, m^b, and m^c.
